oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Ian Matthews Live at the Lone Star Cafe - 1978-05-08
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is from the Lone Star Café live show. The tape features a live performance of Ian Matthews (musician). The Lone Star Café show is presented by Mort Cooperman, Bill McGivney and the WHN radio network. The recording of Ronnie Session is from May 08, 1979.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ian Matthews
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Mike Fitzgerald welcome the audience to the Lone Star Café while introducing the members of the show -- (01:20) Tigers Can Survive (Ian Matthews) -- (05:17) Could Now Be Outstanding [unconfirmed] (Ian Matthews) -- (09:24) Ian Matthews introduces the Razorblades and reveals his new album -- (10:05) Stealin' Home (Ian Matthews) -- (14:53) You Don't See Me (Ian Matthews) -- (19:15) Matthews reflects on an opinion article -- (19:54) Give Me an Inch Girl (Ian Matthews) -- (25:42) Matthews praises the works of Duck Hammond -- (26:28) Don't Hang Up Your Dancin' Shoes (Ian Matthews) -- (29:47) Thursdays (Ian Matthews) -- (34:04) Matthews jokes about ending the set -- (34:30) Shake It (Ian Matthews) -- (38:39) Matthews reveals he forgot his set-list -- (39:04) Catchin' This Next Train Soon (Ian Matthews) -- (45:26) Lonely Hunter (Ian Matthews) -- (51:01) Matthews introduces the Hairdryers -- (53:08) Dancin' the Night Away (Ian Matthews) -- (58:59) Fitzgerald praises Matthews and reintroduces him -- (1:00:48) Slip Away [incomplete] (Ian Matthews)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Matthews, Ian;
